captions.text:
America Comes Together-
Adam Sandler and Bob Barker.

As you probably guessed, Bob
Barker and I haven't spoken with

But we know that providing
schools and services for people

Absolutely, so I'm hanging out
here with Bob helping him with
his soup while his hip heels.
I do not need your help, Adam.

You told me the
soup was hot, Bob.

I'm fine, but you know
you, you are looking old.

I think we're supposed to
talk about autism, Bob.

You're looking
chunkier than the soup.
I guess doing all those movies.
Oh, that's what this is about.

If I had known that I had to
toss your salad to be in another

But Rob Schneider
didn't send me the memo.

I think "Price is
Right" is on now.

He's just so funny and
not crotchety and angry.

You know what else
is great about him?

And never had to do the Lobidy
do, Whacka Whacka Woo voice.
You know like a desperate idiot.

Couldn't be nice,
could you Bobby.

Now you're going
to get it, Bobby.

I thought those balls
would've been a lot lower.
I'll get it back to you.
No, no, no, it's not over yet.

It's not, I can't
let you die on me.

Come back and let
me finish your ass.

Your truly number
one in my book.

How many fucking
asparagus did you eat today?
Is everything okay in this room?
One of us is already 91, dummy.

I wish I could see David Spade's
face when he finds out there

Looks like they like the
Sandman a little bit more.

comments.author: Gia Blue

comments.text:
Adam Sandler's strong point is his physical humor and bringing humor to 
disenfranchised people (old, poor, mentally ill, disabled, etc). Like the 
hobo who becomes his caddy in happy gilmore was hilarious and heartwarming 
because people like that guy exist. They are usually very nice people 
there's just something not quite right up in the noggin. His character 
treated him like a human being instead of someone who's in the way, and 
somehow made it entertaining. Adam always knew how to break conventionality 
and see life through the lens of a kid who's just exploring the world and 
accepting it as it is.﻿
